page.title: 12BICYCLES,MOTORBIKES, MOPEDS
page.content: Out of a survey of l38 households we found an incredible number of 246 bicycles. Most families had 4 bicycles. Half were ladies bicycles and half of them were used mainly to shop in the village. Only 9 people went to work on their bicycle. Majority were used for pleasure riding. In the same survey l9 households had motor bikes, none with a sidecar and 7 had mopeds. Less than half were used to go to work. Had we surveyed households with children at Secondary School we would expect to find a much larger proportion of machines.
